intro: Macrocarpaea pinetorum, commonly known as the pine forest spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the subtropical regions of southern Africa, particularly in the coastal areas of South Africa. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often hidden beneath the foliage. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
